de.erichseifert.gral.util

Class StatefulTokenizer

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.erichseifert.gral.util.StatefulTokenizer

  • public abstract class StatefulTokenizer
extends java.lang.Object
    A tokenizing parser that can analyzes a string using different sets of regular expression based parsing rules and produces a list of tokens. The class is intended to be sub-classed to implement new grammars. Different sets of rules can be defined with the method putRules(String, Rule[]), e.g. for string processing. Each rule in a set produces one token with a type name and it can switch to another state or switch back to the previous state with the special state "#pop". The is a list of tokens with arbitrary type. The list of produced tokens can be filtered: tokens of same type can be joined by adding the type with addJoinedType(Object) and tokens can be omitted from the result for easier post-processing by adding with addIgnoredType(Object).

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      protected static class  StatefulTokenizer.Rule
      A regular expression based rule for building a parsing grammar.
      static class  StatefulTokenizer.Token
      A token that designates a certain section of a text input.
